meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with a hoop.
meanings.sent1: She decided to inhoop the flowers in a beautiful basket.
meanings.sent2: The children inhoop each other in a game of tag.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to inhoop the acorn in its tiny paws.
meanings.sent4: The magician inhooped the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully inhooped the delicate plant to protect it from the wind.

meanings.definition: To form a hoop or hoops.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith inhoops the iron to create a sturdy ring.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast can inhoop her body into amazing shapes.
meanings.sent3: The balloon artist can inhoop balloons into various animals.
meanings.sent4: The dancer inhooped gracefully around the stage.
meanings.sent5: The artist inhooped the wire into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: A circular band of metal, wood, or similar material.
meanings.sent1: She wore a shiny inhoop on her finger as a symbol of love.
meanings.sent2: The barrel was reinforced with an inhoop of steel.
meanings.sent3: The children used the inhoop as a makeshift hula hoop.
meanings.sent4: The old gate creaked on its rusty inhoop.
meanings.sent5: The knight's armor gleamed with a silver inhoop.
